numbered_ace_sentences: 2. The graph shows that a student who is a legacy applicant has an advantage in college admission.
3. The graph shows that a family with a higher income has a higher chance to enter a more selective school.
4. The richest families tend to have the best legacy connections.
5. A student from a richest family with best legacy connections tends to have the best chance of admission.
6. Some students have the same test scores.
7. Even if two students have the same test scores, a legacy student from a richest family tends to have a higher chance of admission than another student.
8. I wonder how the effect of high income has changed over history.
9. I wonder how the effect of being a legacy has changed over history.
10. I ask whether it was always this way.
12. A few months ago, I applied to colleges.
13. During the application process, I wondered how these factors could affect my application.
14. The graph depicts that parents with higher incomes tend to have students who are accepted.
15. The graph depicts that legacy students tend to be accepted.
16. The graph depicts that these students are accepted over other students with similar test scores.
17. The headline is: Money: What cannot it help?
